from nltk.translate.bleu_score import sentence_bleu
from rouge_score import rouge_scorer

# å‚è€ƒæ–‡æœ¬å’Œç”Ÿæˆæ–‡æœ¬
reference = ["the cat is on the mat"].split()
candidate = "the cat sat on the mat".split()

# è®¡ç®—BLEU
bleu_score = sentence_bleu([reference], candidate)
print(f"BLEU Score: {bleu_score:.4f}")

# è®¡ç®—ROUGE
scorer = rouge_scorer.RougeScorer(['rouge1', 'rouge2', 'rougeL'], use_stemmer=True)
scores = scorer.score("the cat is on the mat", "the cat sat on the mat")

for metric, score in scores.items():
    print(f"{metric}: P={score.precision:.4f}, R={score.recall:.4f}, F={score.fmeasure:.4f}")

from bert_score import score

# å‚è€ƒæ–‡æœ¬å’Œç”Ÿæˆæ–‡æœ¬åˆ—è¡¨
refs = ["the cat is on the mat", "a dog is running"]
cands = ["the cat sat on the mat", "a dog runs"]

# è®¡ç®—BERTScore
P, R, F1 = score(cands, refs, lang='en', verbose=True)

print(f"BERTScore Precision: {P.mean():.4f}")
print(f"BERTScore Recall: {R.mean():.4f}")
print(f"BERTScore F1: {F1.mean():.4f}")
